title: Exploring the ABC News’ 538 data
text:
Data from ABC News’ 538 is useful for exploring and analyzing data used in stories from a national news outlet.
Set up your enviornment.

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  echo = FALSE, # By default, hide code; set to TRUE to see code
  fig.pos = 'th', # Places figures at top or here
  out.width = '100%', dpi = 300, # Figure resolution and size
  fig.env="figure"
) # Latex figure environment

# packages and libraries
# install.packages("fivethiryeight")
library(fivethirtyeight)

Some larger datasets need to be installed separately, like senators and
house_district_forecast. To install these, we recommend you install the
fivethirtyeightdata package by running:
install.packages('fivethirtyeightdata', repos =
'https://fivethirtyeightdata.github.io/drat/', type = 'source')

options(knitr.table.format = "latex") # For kable tables to write LaTeX table directly

Load essential libraries.



Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

text:
Alexander, N. N., Appling, T., Banuelos, M., Bello, G., Brown, A., Century, J., Connor, K., Ji, H., Levy, R., Mitchell, P., Mongeau, D., Mysliwiec, M., Niu, J., Paykin, S., Quarkume, A., Schiffman, J., Skinner, L., Uminsky, D. & Zhong, P. (2024). Data Science for Social Impact in Higher Education: First Steps. Data.org Playbook. Available at: https://data.org/playbooks/data-science-for-social-impact-in-higher-education/


Ballenger, H. J., Washington, T., Clark, R., Lockhart, J. W., Adebowale, J., Hearn, D., Dotson, E., Gaines, J., Bennett, V., Teodorescu, D., Alexander, N. Atlanta University Center Data Science Initiative - Data Science for K-12 Listening Session Report. Available at SSRN: http://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.4493108


Jones, Q., Vindas Meléndez, A. R., Mendible, A., Aminian, M., Brooks, H. Z., Alexander, N., Diaz Eaton, C., & Chodrow, P. (2023). Data science and social justice in the mathematics community. Notices of the American Mathematical Society.

Ratliff, N. N. Alexander, & R. Levy (Eds.). Justice through the lens of calculus: Framing new possibilities for diversity, equity, and inclusion. MAA Notes Volume.


Alexander N., Diaz Eaton C., Shrout A. H., Tsinnajinnie B., & Tsosie K. (2022). Beyond ethics: Considerations for centering equity-minded data science. Journal of Humanistic Mathematics, 12(2), 254–300. https://doi.org/10.5642/ jhummath.OCYS6929

Alexander, N. N. (2019). Daija’s awakening: Critical race theory and Afrofuturism in mathematics education. In J. Davis & C. Jett, Critical Race Theory in Mathematics Education (pp. 56-74). Routledge.

title: About
text:
We make use of modern computational tools and software to learn about and respond to local and global issues of in/justice. Our work empowers our members to set up community-centered, near-peer user groups. In these groups, individuals and organizations engage with our team and set up small learning communities to sustain longer term engagement in their local contexts.
we quantify history and the social sciences to learn about in/justice & futurity.

title: Lesson 1
text:
The Quantitative Histories Workshop Model
Prep
Code and data prep should follow the Good enough practices in scientific computing model.
Code directory
Analysis
Analyses can be done in any software program and a clear summary of steps should be included.
Reporting
All reports should be generated using an .RMarkdown.
Case study
To explore this 3-step model, we will use a case study as found in Lesson 02.
